fields.description:
Hi, I have a repo which shows 3GB size and I cannot push there, I had at one time invalid (justified) size due to one of the members push videos to the repo, but I made everything as in manual to remove the mentioned commit and force recalculating size.

Everything was fine until today repo has size 3GB, pushes disabled.

I just removed last commit (1 line change) and made push --force, something had changed and repo has size 2.8GB. Obviously repo one line commit is not 200MB.

Please, help us recover repository, which has no large files and had size approximately 980MB before problems started.
fields.summary: Bitbucket locked repo due to invalid repo size, shows 3GB, but it's not 3GB

fields.description:
OS: 10.14.2 (See attached screenshot)\\
Browser: Chrome 71.0.3578.98 (see attached screenshots)

I'm trying to add branch permissions to repo ansarada/csharplearningpathway. I've done this many times before. But now I cannot get the keyboard focus to "Write Access" & "Merge via pull requests" text boxes to search.

I can get the mouse focus to those text boxes. But when I type it adds characters to the "Branch or pattern" text box where I have already entered the value "master".

See the attached recording.
fields.summary: Unable to configure branch permission

fields.description:
As mentioned in the title, attempting to add branch permission through the user interface is not working correctly. The "Write access" and "merge via pull request" textboxes are not editable after adding a pattern or branch name on the "Branch or pattern" textbox

Steps to reproduce

# Navigate to the repository > Settings > Branch permissions
# Create a new branch permission
# Type anything on the "Branch or Pattern" textbox
# It will not be possible to edit either the "Write access" and "merge via pull request" textboxes, only to select from the dropdown that shows up

!3742547503-Screen%20Shot%202019-01-25%20at%2014.05.13.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branch permissions user interface is not working correctly.

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket does not provide accessibility options to users with Low Vision, such as the ones listed on the link below:

* https://www.w3.org/TR/low-vision-needs/

In many contexts, low vision only includes impairments that are not corrected with regular glasses, contact lenses, medicine, or surgery so, if we do not have this functionality implemented, persons with one of these conditions will not be able to use Bitbucket Cloud properly.

Can you please implement these changes to make your service more accessible to everyone?
fields.summary: Accessibility to Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description: There is no option to transfer user ownership control to another account. Can anyone tell me exact place to transfer the repository to another account?
fields.summary: Transfer Ownership Control To Another Account

fields.description:
I left feedback on several areas of code.  The developer updated the code, and pushed his changes to update the PR.  Now, I can no longer see my comments and their response, in context.  I see that there are 'prior commits', and if I look at one of those, I do see the comments.  But I can't comment on them, as they are marked 'outdated'.

Is there a way to configure so that the comments stay with the file, and not the version of the file, at least for the life of the PR?
fields.summary: comments on code in a PR not shown on the most recent commit

fields.description:
I believe text areas where you write Markdown, such as in this very issue tracker, should use a monospace (fixed-width) font. This makes it easier to align stuff in code blocks and ASCII art diagrams and such. As a bonus, monospace also makes it easier to position the text cursor precisely using the mouse.

I can't find any scientific literature suggesting that monospace for text editing is objectively better (or worse), but I did take a brief look at what everyone else is doing.

First off, nearly all of us coders will be using a monospace font in our code editors.

StackOverflow, whose core business is having people write Markdown, and which strikes me as a pretty data-driven company, uses monospace (to be precise: {{Consolas,Menlo,Monaco,Lucida Console,Liberation Mono,DejaVu Sans Mono,Bitstream Vera Sans Mono,Courier New,monospace,sans-serif}}).

GitLab also uses monospace ({{"Menlo", "DejaVu Sans Mono", "Liberation Mono", "Consolas", "Ubuntu Mono", "Courier New", "andale mono", "lucida console", monospace}}).

GitHub does not use monospace. Rather than taking that as an example, I would see it as an opportunity where Bitbucket can do better ;)
fields.summary: Use fixed-width (monospace) font for Markdown editors

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
No pipelines variable is presenting who performed the current build.

h2. Suggested Solution
Add something like {{BITBUCKET_BUILD_ACTOR}} to default variables of custom pipelines.

h2. Workaround
You can retrieve pipeline's actor information as "creator" attribute via [REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/pipelines/#get] like as below:

{code:bash}
REPOS="__USERNAME__/__SLUG__"
curl -L --request GET \
  --header "Accept: application/json" \
  --url "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/${REPOS}/pipelines/?pagelen=100"
{code}

It's a bit messy but probably you can determine the current pipeline with {{BITBUCKET_BUILD_NUMBER}} variable.

h2. Related Documents
* [Variables in pipelines - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/variables-in-pipelines-794502608.html]
fields.summary: Include actor information to the default variables
Incorrect diffstat api result for changed files (Mercurial)

fields.description: The download time for Pipelines caches varies from a few seconds to several minutes.
fields.summary: Inconsistent cache downloading speed

fields.description: Currently, there's no build status that showed up in pull request page if the pr was created from a fork repositories
fields.summary: Pull request created from fork repositories does not show build status in PR page

fields.description:
The feature that allows you to quickly access test results does not work while logs are streaming in because it keeps re-rendering immediately as you click or hover over it.

"Quickly access test results\\
All your test results in one place, right here in the log viewer.

Learn more"
fields.summary: Can't click on access test results while build is running

fields.description:
Sample use case:

We currently use custom pipelines to do "version bump" processing (e.g., git tagging, etc).\\
This currently is a two-step process, where we update the version in a file in the repository, then invoke the custom pipeline through the web UI for the appropriate branch.

It would be much simpler for us if the custom pipeline could take arguments, for example through additional environment variables.

For example, we might have:

{code}
pipelines:
  custom:
    tag-version:
      - step:
          script:
            - ./tag_version.sh $VERSION
{code}

Then the existing "Run Pipeline for <branch>" window could have an optional "Add Environment Variables to pipeline run" which allows the user to specify additional variables beyond what's already configured in Settings/Pipelines/Repository Variables.

The use of environment variables is just an example here, and I'm not attached to that specific solution if there are alternative ways to pass information from the "run pipeline" UI to the pipeline script.
fields.summary: Support arguments and/or environment for custom pipelines
Support "narrow clone"
Show CSS Rules in tooltip in .vue files (etc.) when user hovers over class name in HTML.

fields.description:
I typically lock down the {{prod}} branch to be for admins only. Today I realized I can no longer do this. I can lock it down to individual users but no longer a group.

Was this intentional? Please add the ability to allow groups to restrict branch access. This is a major security concern for our workflow.
fields.summary: Branch Permissions no longer allows groups to be selected

fields.description:
# I can create a scheduled pipeline but not edit or update it. There is no mention about editing or updating existing schedules in the documentation. Please update the documentation to say this is not supported yet, and then implement a way to edit existing schedules. It seems silly to delete and re-create a schedule just to change when it runs.
# When creating a new Schedule the UI says the time is in "Local Time" AND it says the time is in "UTC". In practice, it runs (or translates) at Local Time. Please update the UI removing conflicting information UTC vs. Local Time. Also, it's my opinion it should absolutely be UTC in the UI.
# When viewing existing pipelines, the UI does not show the full name of the pipeline so that multiple scheduled pipelines look exactly the same. Which one do I enable or disable? Which one do I delete? Who knows because you can't edit it to see which one it actually is.
fields.summary: Ability to edit scheduled pipeline and to see full name of scheduled pipeline

fields.description: Webhook is not triggering and going to see the status is states NET_ERR. Previously I could retrigger the webhook manualy by resending a previous request. Now that is not possible. Is there an issue with webhooks? This started 2 hours ago. Lately we have had big issues with webhook not triggering on all push requests and so on. Seems you have a big issue here?
fields.summary: Webhook not triggering

fields.description:
As per the title - today if it is necessary for someone with write access to add a new environment variable or deployment variable, it's necessary that this person contact the admin of their repository, which can be disruptive.

It would be great to allow users with write access to modify Pipelines environment\\
or deployment variables.
fields.summary: Allow users with write access to create variables

fields.description:
I usually squash commits when merging a PR into a target branch, so I painstakingly tidy up the default description that BitBucket gives you in order to remove all of the artifacts of the various commits into the source branch which are useless  to me (e.g. Adding file missed in last commit, etc.).

Default description provided by BitBucket:

!2843557203-bitbucket-PR-desc-default.PNG|thumbnail!

Reformatted description (as saved in PR):

!3152884277-bitbucket-PR-desc-reformatted.PNG|thumbnail!

However, when I merge the PR, the merge dialog renders with another textbox for editing the description, but the default text is a concatenation of the descriptions from all of the individual commits into the source branch rather than the description from the PR!

Default description for squashed merge:

!3752151119-bitbucket-PR-merge-desc-default.PNG|thumbnail!.

Reformatted (again) merge description:

!797047716-bitbucket-PR-merge-desc-reformatted.PNG|thumbnail!

After merging, this is how the merged PR looks:

!3159042726-bitbucket-PR-merged-desc.PNG|thumbnail!

But this is how the description of the commit looks:

!4276936458-bitbucket-commit-desc.PNG|thumbnail!

Note that BitBucket doesn't respect Markdown when viewing commit descriptions for some reason.

Also, when creating a PR from the original target branch to another target branch, the default description is completely mangled with no respect for the Markdown in the description of the commit from the original merge.

See attached image:

!298216054-bitbucket-PR2-desc-default.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Description for commit into PR target branch doesn't respect the description in the PR itself

fields.description:
If you have a setup where you have a webhook which should trigger on a pull request, but having only the PR updated or PR created events added to the PR, no webhook will trigger on PR merge. The webhook can only be triggered by adding repo:push.

*Scenario:*

# Create a webhook with trigger: PR updated, PR Created
# create a PR from branch Source to destination -> this will trigger a webhook
# now make a commit to the Source Branch -> this will trigger a webhook for PR updated
# create a branch Feature from Source branch while the PR is still open -> make changes to files -> commit those to Feature branch
# Create a PR from Feature Branch to -> Source Branch -> Merge it
# Event in Step 5 - will add a new commit to Source Branch thus updating the PR since the new commit is added to the already open PR from Source to destination - however this event will not trigger a PR updated webhook

The webhook will only be fired if repo:push event is listed as one of the triggers.

Expected behavior:  Since the open PR is updated with a new commit(PR's merge commit), it should trigger a "pullrequest:updated" webhook event
fields.summary: Merging into a pull request's source branch does not trigger a pullrequest:updated webhook

fields.description:
Hello

I am building some service using the REST API 2.0:

/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/commit/{node}/statuses/build

one of the parameters is a url. I am providing: (for example)

http://jenkins:8080

{"type": "error", "error": {"fields": {"url": ["Enter a valid URL."]}, "message": "url: Enter a valid URL."}}

while putting the next url: http://<actual jenkins ip>:8080
results with a success.
Please, I need this to be fixed. I am using later on a library that can only use the redirect IP, which is the "jenkins" one.

Thank you.
fields.summary: set build status using REST API won't accept a valid url

fields.description:
We need a way to archive old repositories as it is possible with github.com.

Moving them simply into another "archived" project (as proposed in [#894|BCLOUD-894]) is not a solution as those repositories still will appear in several lists.

As it can be seen in (unfortunately closed) issue BCLOUD-894 there are many people who requested such a feature.
fields.summary: Mark repositories as "archived" or "inactive"

fields.description:
A lot of people right now are using Bitbucket cloud repository to integrate with Composer.

They use Bitbucket Cloud repository as their "package" when initializing "composer install" into their App.

Since we have a lot of customers are using it, I believe it's best if we can have documentation to guide people on how to do this from scratch.
fields.summary: Bitbucket repository with Composer integration documentation

fields.description: When I'm editing a source file in Bitbucket using the web client at bitbucket.org, if I accidentally hit refresh or previous page, I lose all the changes that I haven't committed yet. The vast majority of websites, when you're editing something, whether that's code, or a text document, spreadsheet, blog post, status update, whatever, when you press refresh/previous page/next page on your web browser, the website popups with an alert box to tell you haven't finished your editing, are you sure you want to navigate away. And then you get an option for yes I'm sure, do navigate away and an option for no, I'm still editing, don't navigate away. This alert gives you a chance to save yourself in the event that you didn't really mean to leave or if you weren't aware you didn't save. How does Bitbucket not have this basic functionality? That is horrible user experience. Nobody should ever lose work because of a misclick or accident.
fields.summary: Online source editor needs to popup with warning if page is navigated away from

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a filter option (Added, deleted, modified) under "Files Changed" portion of a "Pull Request".

Check the attachment for getting an idea about the proposal.
fields.summary: Filter facility for "Files changed" area in a pull request
Add endpoint for getting all pull requests that I'm a reviewer on across multiple repos

fields.description:
Currently I am migrating from git hub and had a minor issue.  The markdown for c# code highlighting had issues.

```c# was causing issues.  using just ``` inserted a code region with no syntax highlighting.

While this works, it is sub optimal.
fields.summary: Support Markdown code highlighting for C#

fields.description:
After-script where introduced recently and they are really good, but for cleanup it would be even better to have an "after-step" and by that i mean a final step or set of steps that would run no matter what happened previously in a pipeline.

I'll give an example that back this proposal.

Let say i have a step with an image that can creates an aws infra. Then i want another step with a python image that can run tests against the infra created in the first step. And at the end, i want to be able to destroy the infra in a third step, using the same image as the step one, no matter if the step 2 was successful or not.\\
With the after-script, the only thing i can do is run a script in my step 2 which dont have what it needs to destroy my aws infra.
fields.summary: Need for an "after-step"

fields.description:
Currently, if you have an existing bookmark (e.g. master) then you rename your branch to "master" as well, Bitbucket cloud will allow it.

However, it will screw up the "diff" feature that we have if we compare the bookmark(master) and branch(master).

It would be best if we can handle this kind of scenario or at least warn customers for possible cause and effects.
fields.summary: Mercurial Diff for same Branch and Bookmark name
Deployment environment variables broken when encrypted / masked

fields.description:
I'm seeing the error below when following steps documented in [Push back to your repository|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/push-back-to-your-repository-962352710.html] support document.

{code}
#!text

remote:         
remote: Warning!        
remote: You are currently connecting with your team account.        
remote: This is no longer supported, so please connect using your user account.        
remote: 
{code}

Adding new tags this way still seems to work.

I'm trying to understand if this is going to break at some point or not or if the message I'm seeing is just a false positive error.

Can you update the documentation if this is no longer supported?
fields.summary: Push back to your repository: Team account warning

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new branch
# Commit code with a commit message\\
a. We are using SourceTree but should happen with git cli as well\\
b. If it's a single commit it uses the commit message as the title. We copy paste to description but If we have multiple commits, the messages fill the description section.

Either way, if the @ symbol is in a commit message in the description section of a pull request the system makes a random reference to a user account outside of our team.

First occurrence was a link to\\
https://bitbucket.org/Section/profile/teams\\
because of @   section was used in our commit message (php laravel blade template language)

Second occurrence to test the theory\\
pull-requests: 86 on affiliate repository\\
Links to https://bitbucket.org/extrazozer/\\
because of @ extrazozer made the connection

I want to make sure this does not give access to these users to our code. I was unable to find any link back to this reference from the /extrazozer account
fields.summary: SECURITY - At symbol Random Reference to non-team member

fields.description:
Dear Engineers,

If a user would like to use a custom "cluster.name" in Pipelines (for example for Elasticsearch), currently it's not possible as the Pipelines build fails with the following message:\\
"A variable key is malformed. All variable keys should contain only\\
alphanumeric characters and underscores and should not begin with a number"
fields.summary: Allow "." (dot) in a variable key

fields.description:
We're using feature [clone depth|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-bitbucket-pipelines-yml-792298910.html%3F#Configurebitbucket-pipelines.yml-ci_depthdepth] only for one specific custom pipeline. There only a way to configure this parameter globally, as result - for all other pipelines we have longer clone process.

I suggest to add ability define or override value of clone depth on pipeline level.
fields.summary: Define clone depth per pipeline

fields.description: Currently, there's no way for the user to get the list of user permission in repositories via API
fields.summary: Add api to list out user permission in repositories

fields.description:
So yesterday everything Pushed & Pulled as it always does, today when I tried to pull from a shared repository, I got this message "external filter 'git-lfs filter-process' failed." Currently I have found nothing which fixes this smudge error, or anything which guides me to a solution.

Any help on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Below I have included the initial error I got when I pulled, along with the git lfs logs last message.

Thank you in advance.
fields.summary: external filter 'git-lfs filter-process' failed

fields.description: As users of both Bitbucket Server and Crucible, it would be nice of we could, on a per-repository basis, disable the built-in PR feature of BB and instead use Crucible for that function. It seems like there is a Crucible-lite inside BB and we'd like to disable it.
fields.summary: Bitbucket & Crucible, together at last

fields.description:
Currently when 'Merged branches' is clicked, it will sometimes show branches that are active and ahead of master. It should only ever show branches that are equal to that of master (i.e. merged)

This is making clean up of older branches extremely difficult.
fields.summary: Merged branches will randomly show non-merged branches

fields.description: I would like to configure the branches of  _bitbucket-pipelines.yaml_ file using regex, not glob patterns, that is very limited. Circle CI is an example of similar software that supports it and it saves us a lot of time and additional configuration.
fields.summary: Regex instead of Glob patterns
Pipeline teardown script has errors

fields.description:
Dear Engineers,

Would it be possible to enable the invitations endpoint for API 2.0? As it's mentioned in the following documentation, it's getting deprecated with API 2.0: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis
fields.summary: Enable invitations endpoint for API 2.0

fields.description:
Bitbucket pipeline has a mechanism in place that allows to save and restore the Gradle cache directory. We work with larger projects (following the mono-repository approach), where this approach may not scale too well. A Gradle cache grows rather quickly and it takes substantial resources already to just pack/unpack the Gradle cache. Moreover, different steps in the pipeline may only need small parts of it.

It would be desirable to have support for https://proandroiddev.com/speed-up-your-build-with-gradle-remote-build-cache-2ee9bfa4e18. As it allows to incrementelly check whether a given task has already been performed.

A simple HTTP repository would already  suffice for it. In other project we made use of Artifactory generic repositories for this purpose. Or if no such feature is planned, it would be useful if there is a possiblity to know the location of the pipeline runners and allow the manual placements by customers (us) next to them. Or maybe allow to provide runners on our own similar to it is possible in Gitlab.
fields.summary: Support Gradle remote build cache

fields.description: When adding comments to a Pull Request, everytime I type @Output (a typescript decorator), on save it is replaced with @Deine Mudda (despite the autocomplete box saying there is no match). This is kind of annoying as the repo this links to is the "Eat My Ass" repo... which, as funny as it is, is really bad to send to Jr Devs who get confused as to why I'm telling them to Eat My Ass. It has also made it an awkward conversation with HR (thanks for that).
fields.summary: @Output get replaced with @Deine Mudda

fields.description:
Hi,

Our Pull Request on few repositories triggers tests in jenkins, but from some reason its stop working few days ago.

did you change something?

or you have any solution that can help us to solve it?!
fields.summary: Webhooks to Jenkins Multibranch Pipeline fail always on NET_ERR

fields.description:
This was brought up a few months ago, I think the issue has since been deleted...

Now I better understand the issue: the code directories are exactly the same (neither branch has been touched since about 4 days ago, so all of that information is consistent); however, the dropdown is NOT switching from 'develop' to 'api/prices' as it should even though both branches are the same for now.

I'm thinking it could be an SPA issue, where the engine thinks it doesn't have to re-render ANY of the page since both branches have the same data.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a branch named 'develop'.
# Fork off of 'develop' a branch named 'api/prices', don't modify it.
# Switch from develop to api/prices.
# Notice that the url refreshes but the dropdown does not.

Environment:

Windows 10 x64, Chrome, AdBlocker (doesn't seem to affect other branches though).

Attached: Demonstration of switching from 'develop' to 'api/prices' branch where the url has changed but the dropdown has not updated my selection.
fields.summary: Branch dropdown fails to switch for develop branch to slash branch
using POST request for repository src to include about 300 files in one commit fails with 500

fields.description: We work in a growing microservices platform where we have dozens of builds that will eventually be hundreds. We would like a more centralized view of the pipelines build statuses. We think it would be easiest to provide a view of all recent and running builds at a project level which would include all repos in that project. The view could be exactly the same as an individual pipeline view.
fields.summary: Project-wide pipelines view

fields.description:
Also what does not work is the Branches option

This is from https://bitbucket.org/consortiex/repo-00
fields.summary: I can not access my Source from the BitBucket web page

fields.description:
We have very similar language in the *Compare* branch view which can confuses others and cause people who've meant to master into a feature, merge the other way around:

*Sync*: Merge master into feature branch

*Sync now*: Merge feature into master

When someobody syncs a branch from the '...' menu (under *Branches*), if their feature branch is some number of commits ahead of master, they'll be brought to _Compare_ view.

There are two options on this screen:

*Merge* (this will merge master into feature)

*Sync now* (this will merge feature into master)

We should make it more clear which direction the merge is taking place.
fields.summary: 'Merge' vs. 'Sync now' in Compare view
Mentions broken in Safari / iOS

fields.description: In the webhook request history it would be a useful feature to add the source IP address where each request is sent from. It would help in debugging significantly knowing where that failed request came from.
fields.summary: At webhooks request history add the source IP

fields.description:
###Problem Definition###\\
There is an unnecessarily long horizontal spacing in the new Source view for a repository, resulting in being required to use a horizontal scroll bar to scroll all the way to the right.

This can be observed with different browsers as well as with incognito mode.

!1096862797-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

If the New source browser experience is turned off in Bitbucket Labs. the old Source view displays the page with the proper spacing, resulting in there being no need to scroll horizontally.\\
!526720994-Capture2.PNG|thumbnail!

###Suggested Solution ###\\
Reduce the horizontal spacing.
fields.summary: Reduce horizontal spacing in the New Source Browser view

fields.description:
Dear,

I can not add a team member to reach the 5 limit even so we are currently 4.\\
It seems that the previous fifth member I removed was not properly removed, since it displays 4 and still has the blocking of the add new members.

Regards
fields.summary: Can not add a team member, even so we did not reach the 5 limit yet

fields.description: The branches UI shows that a branch is merged, even if a pull request shows 4 commits ahead.
fields.summary: Branch shows as merged when it really is ahead

fields.description:
Hi there,\\
would be great to allow bitbucket pipelines to push to master from the branch permissions page.\\
We bump up the version number in the package.json file of our repos automatically and we need to push it back to the repo.\\
Problem is that we have a branch permission policy in place to prevent users from pushing directly to master.\\
The two options are in conflict. If it were possible to allow pipelines to push back to master, we would be able to achieve this.

Thank you
fields.summary: Add bitbucket pipeline user

fields.description:
My team has a parent repository with common code that is shared by 4 forked children. We recently implemented branch permissions on the forked children so that edits can only be made via a merged pull request. What this means in practice is we are inhibited from syncing the parent repository to the forked repositories. Instead, we had to give a team member write access directly to the main branch of the forked repository, which defeats the purpose of branch permissions.

The idea is therefore to separate permissions into merge by PR and syncing, so that I may sync from the parent but cannot otherwise edit the branch directly.
fields.summary: Separate fork sync from merge by PR in branch permissions

fields.description: Currently, if the source branch of a pull request is deleted, the pull request can end up in a bad state where you're unable to edit the pull request (source branch will appear missing). It will make more sense to warn the user that the source branch has been deleted instead of trying to load the pull request indefinitely.
fields.summary: Create better error message if source branch of pull request is deleted

fields.description:
Hi there,

we have two endpoints for webhooks (to trigger jenkins builds):

We needed to go through ngrok for a while and used this endpoint: https://user:pw@ondewo-ci.ngrok.io/bitbucket-scmsource-hook/notify/. This still works fine.

We don't need the ngrok tunnel anymore and set up this endpoint: https://user:pw@ci.ondewo.com/bitbucket-scmsource-hook/notify/ which constantly gives us so-called NET_ERR errors. Those requests don't even reach our end. We can verify they exist and respond with a simple curl request.

What does NET_ERR mean ?

And why do we receive that error ?

What can we do to fix that ?

o/
fields.summary: Webhook's requests don't reach us

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The Wiki editor sometimes do not display the proper markdown in the preview mode when the French language is set to be the display language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce###
# Set the display language for Bitbucket to be French the Bitbucket profile settings.
# Open a wiki page in a repository and add the following snippet then click on "Preview" on the top right:

{code}
Test

#!php
cd /foo/bar

Some text

{code}

h3. Expected Results###
In the preview, it will display like this:

Test

{code}
cd/foo.bar
{code}

Some text

h3. Actual Results
It actually displays like this:

{code}
Test ``` #!php cd /foo/bar ``` Some text
{code}

h3. Notes
# The results can be inconsistent but can be observed after multiple attempts
# it can happen for different browsers.
fields.summary: The "Preview" mode of the Wiki editor will not correctly display the proper markdown occasionally in French.

fields.description:
Branch cannot be created with special characters from UI.\\
!3814917179-Co3miXH7ToKaGujTLcSLyg%5B1%5D.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branch cannot be created with special characters

fields.description:
I'm not sure what's the exact mechanics behind this, but commit list seems to be cached in a way which makes most recent commits invisible in certain situations.\\
Basic steps to see this problem: click any commit number to see the commit changes -> go back with the browser to the commit list -> recent commits are gone from the list, sometimes even the one that you just saw on it's details page.\\
In my case refreshing bitbucket cache (ctrl + f5 on windows) on commit list helps getting newest commits to the cache, so I can navigate history to the list and see every commit. When I specifically click on 'commits' tab, recent commits are visible too, so that's good. But as soon as I navigate via browser history to commits and there are some new ones, I don't see them.
fields.summary: Commit list is cached

fields.description: No means to unlink the commit and branch or button for it, no button for PR as well.
fields.summary: No means to unlink the commit and branch or button for it

fields.summary: Can't pull with mercurial 4.8.2

fields.description:
When there is a comment on a pull request and the email is set out about the comment, it says "View this pull request or add a comment by replying to this email. "\\
Replying to the email did not put anything on the website.

To be fair, I did only wait 10 minutes before submitting this bug, but I would have expected it to work within that time.

I have not tried to test it again, but can if needed.

I sent my email using the gmail web UI.
fields.summary: PR reply to comment by "replying to this email" doesn't work

fields.description: When you create a branch from Jira and select a "from branch" different from the default one, branch is still created from the default branch.
fields.summary: Destination folder changes to default when you selected different one

fields.description: I transferred a repository to a group that has paid access. This should allow for repositories over 2GB in size. I shouldn't be getting this error message when I try to push now that I'm paying for bitbucket. LFS has 1GB remaining, so it isn't that.
fields.summary: Repository is in read only mode (over 2 GB size limit)

fields.description:
When viewing a single issue, it would be convenient to have Previous and Next links.

Currently, you have to go back to Issue list and then select Next issue which is awkward when you are updating a series of issues.
fields.summary: Single Issue Display - Previous Next

fields.description:
In a repository, we can set what language a repository is written.

Hence, it would be best if we can have a feature that will keep track of dependencies' versions based on it's written language.

h3. Scenario
For example, if a repository is written in Node.js, would it be possible for us to have a portion inside the repository that will check if dependencies are up to date or in need of udpate?
fields.summary: Security alerts for repository based on language
Add overflow-x: scroll  for code blocks in markdown readme
Granular permissions to tracking issues
reference to specific field of an issue

fields.description:
We've moved some of the authentication pieces with managed accounts, accounts with domains are claimed, or accounts with Atlassian access enabled.

Logging into the Bitbucket UI should be no issue, but there will be inconsistent authentication issues (via HTTPS) with the following services:

* Git LFS
* API
* Git / Mercurial scm

The workaround is to use [App passwords|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/app-passwords-828781300.html] instead of the normal basic auth login/password, as managed accounts will not recognize certain services.
fields.summary: Inconsistent authentication across services in Bitbucket

fields.description:
The issue found on a support ticket and community post:\\
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Define-MAIN-BRANCH-when-create-repo-via-REST-API-2-0/qaq-p/734832

and BCLOUD-13306_branch

Even though we have this parameter, it doesn't seem like we can update it as the mainbranch is part of the _repository settings_ (different than the repository endpoint), in which we don't allow access to. We need to make the documentation more clear about this

via: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D#post
fields.summary: API repository endpoint documentation - defining mainbranch not clear

fields.description:
For all Git-Related features I can clone and fork repositories at will, but there is a bunch of settings in BitBucket that are outside of its scope (branch permissions, links, merge strategy, etc.).

I would like the ability to fork a repository and keep all of this configuration, as a way to define good templates. Manually creating a new repository and doing all configuration is slow, boring and error-prone.

I did a test and it seems that it only retained custom links configuration (regexp and URL).
fields.summary: Method to copy repository configuration.

fields.description:
I visited a PR page, zoomed all the way out, then scrolled down. The hamburger menu appeared without pressing it. When scrolling back up, the hamburger menu disappears.

See video.
fields.summary: Zooming out and scrolling down causes hamburger menu to randomly appear on iPhone X

fields.description:
*Context:*\\
Repo has a pipeline with a pull-request "release/**" step.

*What I expect to happen:*\\
If a pull-request on said branch to master is open and the pipeline steps have previously ran successfully (for a pull-request of the "release" branch), the pipeline should re-run the pull-request "release" steps if the branch has been updated by a pull-request merge from a "feature", etc. branch.

Right now, the only way to do this is to directly commit to the pull-request branch.

*What did happen:*\\
Pull request pipeline only ran the default steps and ignored re-running the PR steps for the branch.

*Bug:*\\
As a user, I expect the pipeline to re-run the pull-request steps on a branch if an update has been made from merging a different branch to it.
fields.summary: When pull-request updated by merging branch, pull-request pipeline does not run again.

fields.description:
I've deleted large files of my repository in order to reduce repository size, [using BFG as suggested here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/reduce-repository-size-321848262.html].

However the repository size didn't decrease at all, it says it's using 2 GB, even though a fresh {{git clone}} takes up about 50 MB of space.
fields.summary: Repository size doesn't decrease after deleting large files

fields.description:
Panel size can't be correctly increased.

Chromium version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) Built on Ubuntu , running on Ubuntu 18.04 (64-bit).
fields.summary: Right-side panel resize issues

fields.description:
I would like to see task lists supported in markdown rendered in bitbucket.

This should render the task list as read only - *not* to create checkboxes that the user can select and deselect on the rendered page like [#8586|BCLOUD-8586]

I want to be able to commit a markdown document with items being marked as completed or not at the time of commit.
fields.summary: Support markdown task lists (read only)

fields.description: Repo name - velocloud.src
fields.summary: repo size reached to 2.2 GB, need garbage collection

fields.description:
I deleted a team some time ago and it is still shown in my team list.\\
If I click on the team name list I get a 404 - the team name is: 'lazageed'
fields.summary: deleted team still shown in team list

fields.description:
Hello, I think this is a bug.

We have a forked a private repo and the codebase has diverged, However when a PR is created in the fork for merging with upstream, the PR automatically defaults to merge with develop branch of the original (untracked) repo. git remote -v with Repo2 correctly lists only Repo2 remote being tracked, and does not list Repo1 being tracked.

e.g

Repo1 is forked into a new repo called Repo2.\\
Changes made to Repo2 and then creating a PR to merge with Repo2/develop automatically defaults to Repo1/develop. It should be Repo2/develop.

This is confirmed as not intended since git remote -v correctly dipslays tracking for origin/Repo2 and not Repo1, yet it still defaults to Repo1 in the PR.
fields.summary: PR for a forked repo automatically defaults to upstream in the original untracked repo and not the tracked fork remote.

fields.description:
We currently have our repositories in BitBucket and CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps (they are .NET projects).

When a commit triggers a build in the CI via webhook, the build status is reported back to BitBucket correctly.

Currently Azure DevOps has a feature that notification on build status can only be sent to "Team Members" which are Azure DevOps users and not BitBucket users. This means that it's not possible to configure build notification at Azure Devop's side *for the user who did the push.*

For more information, please see the issue I opened at Azure Devops' side: [https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/421119/notification-not-sent-for-triggered-ci-builds-from.html](Link URL)

*I propose a feature for webhooks that would allow notification sent to the user who pushed the code.*
fields.summary: Azure DevOps integration and build status notifications

fields.description:
The user that use https to push back to repositories is getting an error:

{code}
remote: Warning!        
remote: You are currently connecting with your team account.        
remote: This is no longer supported, so please connect using your user account. 

{code}

This occurs because the team account repositories are using GitAuthProxy to generate an access token for team account which is going to be deprecated soon and causes the above error. However, if the user is pushing using https it can be ignored as the change is still being made even with the error.
fields.summary: User who push back to repositories receive an error *You are currently connecting with your team account.*

fields.description:
My account has the right to access a repository.\\
I added a pub key to my account.\\
until few days ago, I have not problem to use it with the pub key.

but suddenly, I can't access the repo with the pub key.

== result when I do "git push" ==\\
git@bitbucket.org: Permission denied (publickey).\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.\\
== end ==

I'm work in linux env.\\
I want to use a specific priv key.\\
so I created a Host like this.\\
== my ssh/config ==\\
Host NEW_HOST\\
Hostname bitbucket.org\\
IdentityFile ~/.ssh/MY_PRIV_KEY.pem\\
== end ==

I already mentioned, I did NOT have any problem until few days ago.

so I tried to make new priv & new pub key.\\
and add the new pub key to bitbucket to my account.

I can push with the new priv key.\\
so I think BITBUCKET is blocking my priv key.

Folloing is my questions.

# can you tell me what's wrong?
# How can I figure out my key pairs are blocking or not.

thanks.
fields.summary: Suddenly, I can't use my key

fields.description:
Hello Developers,

Here are steps to reproduce the issue:

* Open new Firefox's private window.
* Open a Bitbucket project.
* Hide the sidebar.
* Navigate to some parts of the project.
* The sidebar shows itself again.

I think it's inconvenient. Would you please update that behavior, so that the sidebar remembers its state?

Thank you,
fields.summary: The sidebar does not remember its closed-state in Firefox's private windows

fields.description:
I've pushed multiple changesets, with commit messages in two of them containing "resolve #xx". (Where xx is a number of an existing issue, different numbers in different messages). The issues are still not resolved, though the commits have successfully reached central repository in Bitbucket.

I've been using this functionality for months, so I am puzzled about what could be wrong.
fields.summary: Resolving issue via commit doesn't work

fields.description:
Today on Bitbucket, it's possible to integrate with Slack and manage which messages should be sent and which shouldn't.

However, it's not possible to alter the content of those messages, they are all pre-set, and when a larger message needs to be sent it ends up flooding the chat.

It would be great to be able to customize event messages (chat notifications) on the Bitbucket-Slack integration, instead of just allowing to choose which messages are going to be sent
fields.summary: Allow for customized event messages on the Bitbucket-Slack integration

fields.description:
Currently, if you use the API endpoint ("/2.0/repositories/{username}/{repo_slug}/diff/{spec}"), the API is giving a non-empty result even if there's no expected result.

*API*: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/diff/%7Bspec%7D
fields.summary: Diff API producing a non-empty diff when previewmerge-ing ancestor against a descendants

fields.description:
Recently, I had a pull request that was initially targeted at the wrong destination branch. The PR pipeline ran and failed, at which point I noticed and corrected the destination branch.

*Expected behavior*: the pull request reruns against the new target branch.

*Observed behavior*: the pipeline didn't rerun against the new branch, and the failed test status continued to display on the retargeted PR.

Rerunning the pipeline seemed to trigger a build against the _old_ destination branch, which continued to fail. Rejecting and reopening the PR also failed to trigger a new pipeline (the stale result was used on the new PR).
fields.summary: Rerun Pull Request pipelines when the destination branch changes

fields.description:
When building ansible roles in an ansible-galaxy compatible manner (or forking them from github) the root of the ansible role definition is the root of the repository.

Let's say we have a repo with a name of  {{myname.ansible-role-name}}, which will result in an root file structure of:

{code}
bitbucket-pipelines.yml
defaults/
files/
handlers/
meta/
molecule/
README.md
requirements.txt
tasks/
templates/
vars/
{code}

When using molecule to test these locally you can just run "molecule test" in the root of this directory structure as long as the name of the directory you are in matches the name of the role specified in {{molecule/default/playbook.yml}}

ie.

{code}
---
- name: Converge
  hosts: all
  roles:
    - role: myname.ansible-role-name
{code}

Then when you execute the pipeline to run your molecule tests the system is unable to find the role you have defined because it is checked out into the path defined by the {{BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR}} of {{/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build}}

The proposed change would be that the code is checked out into\\
{{/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/$BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG}}\\
instead to solve the problem (and creating a {{build}} symlink to this $BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG would probably help for backwards compatibility).\\
This will likely help other path aware/dependent code builds and automation pipelines.
fields.summary: Creation of ansible roles with molecule tests doesn't work due to checkout directory name

fields.description: Currently, we have no reliable way to backup and restore this data for customers. Mistakes happen, and sometimes specific items are deleted with no way to recover these. Let's make it easier for customers to retrieve specific items that may have accidentally been removed.
fields.summary: Ability to restore: pull requests, groups, comments (account metadata)

fields.description:
Users would like the ability to configure insecure registries in the pipelines docker daemon.

https://docs.docker.com/registry/insecure/

Currently we dont allow users to configure the docker daemon due to security reasons.

However this setting is reasonable to allow users to configure.

We currently configure aspects of the docker daemon using environment variables we could allow users to add insecure registries via a similar mechanism.

{code}
#!yaml

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        services:
          - docker
        script:
          - docker system info

definitions:
  services:
    docker:
      environment:
        INSECURE_REGISTRIES: "http://registry:port"
{code}
fields.summary: Allow users to configure insecure docker registries in the pipelines docker daemon.

fields.description:
It sure would be nice to have a button next to the git command to copy to clipboard after you create a new branch. See below for image.

!2032335190-Screen%20Shot%202019-01-10%20at%202.39.52%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to copy-to-clipboard git command on branch creation

fields.description:
As an admin-permissioned, I want the ability to edit the details of a Pull Request to make minor corrections in descriptions, modify the list of reviewers, and change the merge destination so that, if the author is not available, we can continue work with the PR as-is.

As a write-permissioned user, I want the ability to add reviewers so that I can invite more knowledgable parties to the PR for review.
fields.summary: Non-author Edit of Pull Requests

fields.description:
In larger organizations, it becomes a bit harder to browse activity based on updated pull requests, and extremely large activity feeds. The problems are as follows:

# New PR experience removes the Activity feed tab. Large organizations sometimes depend on this for updates.
# In large pull requests, the truncated activity feed often will miss something that came in via e-mail. If someone commented on the diff view, then this comment will be lost by the time the pull request gets updated. Going to the affected file in the new right pane doesn't seem to have any comments associated with it.
fields.summary: Activity Feed, updated comments in large organizations (New PR experience view)

fields.description:
A couple of years ago a bitbucket-hosted project merged a pull request we submitted, and we were @'ed in the commit message:

https://bitbucket.org/LaNMaSteR53/recon-ng/commits/9fdc4d7e7cd4f255e3ebea9552d242faae182841

That generated a notification email as expected; "Email me about... Someone mentioning me" is enabled.

Ever since then, apparently every time someone forks the LaNMaSteR53/recon-ng repo, we get another notification from that old 2017-04-17 commit 9fdc4d7.

I thought this might be a FAQ but didn't find anything from searching for a few obvious keywords.

It really doesn't make sense to regurgitate old notifications every time a project is forked, it's wasteful of bitbucket.org resources and it spams your users/contributors to hosted projects.
fields.summary: bitbucket.org project forks trigger duplicate commit/mention email notifications
